holidays.name: International Day for Tolerance
holidays.description: A day dedicated to fostering mutual understanding and respect among cultures and peoples worldwide.
holidays.origin: Established by UNESCO in 1995 to promote tolerance and peace.
holidays.funFact: This day is marked by numerous events worldwide aimed at fighting intolerance, discrimination, and violence.

holidays.name: National Button Day (USA)
holidays.description: A celebration of buttons, those tiny fasteners that hold our clothes together and often serve as quirky fashion statements.
holidays.origin: Created by the American Button Society in 1938 to recognize the history and artistry of buttons.
holidays.funFact: Collectors of buttons, known as 'fabophiles,' can find buttons made from everything from glass to wood to precious metals!

holidays.name: Fast Food Day
holidays.description: An ode to the convenience, variety, and guilty pleasures of fast food.
holidays.origin: An unofficial celebration embracing the culture of fast food and its impact on society.
holidays.funFact: On this day, fast food chains sometimes offer special deals or new menu items to mark the occasion.

holidays.name: Buy Nothing Day
holidays.description: A counter-cultural day encouraging people to not purchase anything for 24 hours to reflect on consumerism.
holidays.origin: Started by activists in Canada in 1992 as a protest against overconsumption.
holidays.funFact: Buy Nothing Day often follows Black Friday, challenging consumers to rethink their spending habits.
